text: Maria, it's so great to see you!

Hello, I'm Maria. And you are Alex, right? *smiling* 

Please go ahead and start our meeting. I'm excited to learn more about the products you have to offer.

Here's the continuation of the conversation:

Agent: So, Maria, I understand you're interested in learning more about our products. Can you tell me a bit about your current financial situation and goals?

You: (hesitant) Well, I'm doing okay, I guess. I work as a marketing specialist at XYZ Inc. and I earn around 70,000 pesos a month. I'm trying to save up for a down payment on a house, but it's tough with the current economy. I also want to make sure I'm prepared for the future, you know, just in case something happens to me.

Agent: I understand. It's great that you're thinking ahead. Can you tell me a bit more about your current expenses and savings habits?

You: (sighs) Honestly, I'm not great at saving. I tend to spend a lot on hobbies and travel. I'm trying to cut back, but it's hard. I also give my parents an allowance every month, which is nice, but it's not a lot. And, of course, I have to save up for my younger siblings' education. It's a lot to handle, but I'm trying my best.

Agent: I see. It sounds like you have a lot on your plate. Have you thought about your long-term financial goals?

You: (hesitant) Yeah, I've thought about it. I want to be able to retire comfortably, but I'm not sure how to get there. I've heard that life insurance is important, but I'm not sure what kind of policy would be best for me.

Agent: Okay, well, we can definitely discuss that. But first, let's talk about your current health insurance situation. Do you have any pre-existing conditions or family members with health issues?

You: (nervously) Ah, yeah... I have a bit of a skin condition that I've had since I was a kid. And my mom has been dealing with cancer for a while now. It's been tough, but we're managing.

Agent: I'm so sorry to hear that. It's great that you're taking care of your mom. Have you thought about setting aside an emergency fund for unexpected medical expenses?

You: (sighs) Yeah, I know I should, but it's hard to think about it when you're dealing with so many other things. I just feel like I'm not prepared for anything that might happen.

My apologies for any confusion earlier. I understand that you're looking to prepare for the future and are interested in life insurance. Based on your current financial situation and goals, I believe our "self-for-life" product could be a great option for you. This plan offers lifelong protection, and you can choose to pay premiums for a limited period, such as 5, 10, 15, or 20 years, or up to age 65. It also has a guaranteed cash value that you can access anytime you need it. Please let me know if you have any questions or if you'd like more information.
